title: AIDA 15 Amp Toggle Light Switch, 4 Way, Grounding Screw, Residential Grade Electrical Wall Switch, UL Listed (White, 10 Pack)

feature_bullets: ⭐Four Way — This switch is your go to for a traditional 4 way on/off toggle switch that perfectly blends with its surroundings, guaranteed to last and offers the benefit of being controlled by THREE locations.
⭐Residential Grade — Rated up to 15A, this switch is capable of supporting general household uses without concern about overload.

⭐Easy Installation — Traditional screw terminals available to accommodate every installation method making it the perfect replacement for any 4 way switch in your home. Self-grounding when installed in a properly grounded metal wall box. Complete installation instructions included.

⭐Great Quantity — Intended for demanding residential applications. Use it for the living room, bedroom, dining area, kitchen, home office, hallway, garage, or anywhere else in the home or office where you require a switch.

⭐100% Guarantee & Service – Increase the safety of your electrical system by using this UL certified AIDA light switch. Backed 90-days free return & free lifetime technical online support within 24 hours.

customer_reviews.review_title: 4.0 out of 5 starsQuiet Toggle Switch 15 Amp 4 Way 120/277 VAC-10 Pack-NO PUSH IN BACK Wire Points-Side Screws Only-UL
customer_reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 30, 2020
customer_reviews.review_snippet: I received this product in exchange for my honest review as part of the Amazon Vine Program. Seller AIDA lists these as "AIDA 15 Amp 4 Way Toggle Switch Self-Grounding Indoor Quiet Turn ON Off Toggle, Residential Grade, UL Listed, Side Wired, 10 Packs, White". I had a toggle switch fail and decided to give these a try. This 10 pack of Residential Toggle Switches is UL listed. The switches have appropriate J Box screws and screw terminals on each side as well as a ground screw. (Picture 1). These can be used to do 4 way switching with a "traveler" wire and come with a diagram. I did find that these switches as noted in their title and description DO NOT have push in wire connector points on the back (Picture 3). This is clearly stated by the seller but it is a fairly standard feature on most switches and outlets and detracts from the overall usefulness and ease of installation rating. Also, close examination shows NO "ON" or "OFF" letters on the plastic toggle. Most switches have that lettering. The toggle action is firm and positive without a "snap" sound like older style toggle switches. Without care one could easily install a switch upside down accidentally - you can tell only by the ground screw located at the switch bottom if you don't pay attention to hot and neutral wire colors. Consequently I have given these a 4 Star rating. Recommended with limits stated.
